data.title: MAXWELL'S TEMPURA BLADE
data.meta_description:
noragami character song translations -
i know some of these are out there already, but i’ve had trouble finding the others, and i kind of wanted to try translating them anyway. links, romaji, and...
data.text:
noragami character song translations -

i know some of these are out there already, but i’ve had trouble finding the others, and i kind of wanted to try translating them anyway. links, romaji, and english translations are all under the cut.

if you see any glaring mistakes (or can fill in the missing spoken lines), please tell me, i can always use the help!

月夜ノ舟 (Tsukiyo no Fune) - Yato (Kamiya Hiroshi)

[KANJI]

ROMAJI:

fui ni, denwa ga nari

yatto hitoshigoto oete

donna yashiro tateyou ka to

niya tsuiteta tasogare no ato de

taiyou ga nishi e shizumi

mikadzuki ga pokkari ukanda

musubi aeru, warai aeru

nakamatachi ni deatta

tsukiyo no fune wo koidashita

kore kara doko e yukou?

mienu hazu no ore wo mitsuke

nandomo tasukerareta enishi

rokudemonai yatsu dakedo

ore ga mitsukete, na wo tsuketa enishi

me ga atta sono shunkan

kaze no nagare ga kawattanda

tomo ni ikiru, chikara ni naru

yorizoi au, kizuna de

tsukiyo no fune ni yurare nagara

doko made yukeru darou?

aitsutachi ga itekureta kara

ore wa ima koko ni iru

…wasurenai de ite hoshii

ima wa mukashi, monogatari wa

tooku no se ni tadayou

zutto sagashiteta kono kai de

mae ni susundeiku dake

musubi aeru, shinji aeru

umareta basho* chigattemo

tsukiyo no fune ni yurare nagara

doko made mo yukeru hazu

ENGLISH:

the phone rings unexpectedly

finally, one job done

wondering what kind of shrine to build,

grinning broadly in the twilight

the sun sinking in the west,

the crescent moon floated above

forming ties, laughing together,

I went out to meet my friends

we began rowing this ship on a moonlit night

where shall we go from here?

looking for the me that you probably shouldn’t be able to see

these connections have saved me so many times

I may be just a good-for-nothing guy, but

I forged these bonds and gave them a name

in that moment when our eyes met,

the flow of the wind changed

living together, becoming strength

through the bonds forged along the way

while this ship sways on a moonlit night,

how far can we go?

it’s because those guys are here for me

that I’m here now

…I want you to stay and not forget

now, the tales of my past

are drifting in far-off shallows

with this paddle I’ve searched for for so long,

I will proceed only forward

forming ties, believing together

unlike/despite the place* where I was born

while this ship sways on a moonlit night,

we could probably go anywhere

* read as “place” but written as “shore”

キャッチボール (Catch Ball) - Yukine (Kaji Yuuki)

[KANJI]

ROMAJI:

mezameta toki ni ore wa

yurayura sora wo tadayotteta

nanika sagashimono wo

shiteta you na ki ga suru

me ga atta jaaji no otoko ni

“yukine” to nazukerarete

ore wa shinki ni nattanda

sou da!

enishi musunde tomo ni ikiru

kokoro to kokoro no kyacchi booru

donna basho de na wo yobaretemo

chanto kotaeru kara

taiguu wa saiaku da shi

iitai koto mo ooi kedo

mune no oku, sasatta toge wa

itsu no ma ni ka kieteta

doushiyou mo nai ore no koto

itsumo kangaete kureru

tomodachi mo ite tanomoshii yo

sou sa!

hitori bocchi ja dekinai koto

dekiru ima ga totemo shiawase da

kimi ga waratte hanatta booru

chanto kaeseru kana?

tanoshii, ureshii, setsunai

onaji omoi, wakeau toki

zutto tsuzukeba ii noni na

enishi musunde tomo ni ikiru

kokoro to kokoro no kyacchi booru

kono na no you ni shiroku tsuyoku

sora wo dakishimete

hitori bocchi ja dekinai koto

dekiru ima ga totemo shiawase da

zutto zutto hoshikatta mono

koko ni aru ki ga shite

ookiku en wo egaite tobu

ashita mo kono sora ni

ENGLISH:

when I woke up,

I was drifting through a wavering sky

feeling as if I had been

searching for something

the guy in the jersey who met my eyes

gave me the name “yukine”

and I became a shinki

that’s right!

our fates were tied, and now we live together

playing catch from heart to heart

no matter where my name is called from,

I’ll definitely respond

I get treated terribly

there are a lot of things I want to say, but

the harsh words stuck deep inside me

disappear before I know it

even though there’s not much I can do,

I have reliable friends here too

who are always thinking about me

yeah!

the things I couldn’t do alone,

I’m so happy I can do now

the ball that you let loose, laughing

can I properly return it?

enjoyment, happiness, heartbreak

I hope that those times when we share the same feelings

will continue forever

our fates were tied, and now we live together

playing catch from heart to heart

I embrace the emptiness/sky,

white and strong like this name

the things I couldn’t do alone,

I’m so happy I can do now

it feels like the things I always, always wanted

are right here

I’ll draw a big circle, and fly

into this sky tomorrow, too

ミタイ·セカイ (Mitai Sekai) - Hiyori (Uchida Maaya)

[KANJI]

ROMAJI:

seifuku no botan shimete

nareta kawagutsu haite

itsumodoori gakkou e iku

nichijou ga garari kawatta

nagai shippo wo tatete

nigemawaru mayoi neko

oikakeru hito no sugata

ano toki, tashika ni mita no

kokochi ii nioi wo tsurete

kaze wa yattekita

fushigi fukashigi na deai kara

kirari kiseki ga umareta yo

yume mitai dakedo yume janai

fuwari karada ga karukunareba

mieru keshiki mo chigau no desu

kono sora motto nagameteitai

mitai mirai sekai

kudaranai koto bakari de

kenka wo suru futari

tayorinakute darashinakute

wagamama ni mo nayamasareru kedo

kazoku mitai ni jare autoko

miteru to ureshikute

fushigi fukashigi na deai kara

kirari kiseki ga umareta yo

daiji na hito wa soba ni iru

sururi kuragari wo surinekete

hottoshita kao de waraiau

kono shiin zutto nagameteitai

miteitai kara

wasurenai kara…

fushigi fukashigi na deai kara

kirari kiseki ga umareta yo

daiji na hito wa soba ni iru

ikutsumono kabe, norikoete

hottoshita kao de waraiau

kono shiin zutto nagameteitai

mitai mirai sekai

ENGLISH:

fastening the buttons on my uniform

wearing my familiar leather shoes

going to school, same as always

my everyday life suddenly changed

a long tail sticking out

a stray cat running from place to place

the figure of the person chasing it

I definitely saw him then

the wind came to me,

carrying a comforting smell

ever since that mysterious, inexplicable meeting

like a flash of light, a miracle occurred

it feels like a dream, but it’s not

when this light body becomes weightless

even the scenery around me looks different

I want to look at this sky more

the future world I want to see

the two of them fight

over stupid, trivial things

he’s unreliable and undisciplined

and afflicted by self-indulgence, but

they joke around just like a family

just watching it makes me happy

ever since that mysterious, inexplicable meeting

like a flash of light, a miracle occurred

the people important to me are right beside me

smoothly slipping through the gloom

laughing together with relieved expressions

I want to watch this scene forever

because I want to keep seeing this

because I won’t forget…

ever since that mysterious, inexplicable meeting

like a flash of light, a miracle occurred

the people important to me are right beside me

overcoming any number of walls

laughing together with relieved expressions

I want to watch this scene forever

the future world I want to see

花篝り (Hanakagari) - Bishamon & Kazuma (Sawashiro Miyuki & Fukuyama Jun)

[KANJI]

ROMAJI:

(bishamon:)

kaze wo kiri, tsuchi wo keri

gekai wo ichibou ni

yuuken na maeashi ga uzuku, ouma ga toki

(kazuma:)

hooi wo yomi, kyori wo yomi

toutoi aruji no tame

seikaku na shiji shirei, waga shimeinari

(bishamon (kazuma):)

mimagou na, sono me de

(kaben izure mo)

hyouteki wo sagase

(kakete wa naranu)

(both:)

tomose, tomose, to te hanakagari

kanashiki honoo no mai

nozomi nakaba ni kuzureochita

itooshii inochi, kaeranu

(bishamon:)

sora wo se ni, yami wo se ni

yukute wa hirakareshi

(kazuma:)

aruji no teki wa warera no teki

itsudemo tomo ni

(kazuma (bishamon):)

tamerau na sono te de

(kaben izure mo)

akki wo toraeyo

(kakete wa naranu)

(both:)

moyase, moyase, to te hanakagari

hageshii honoo no mai

kataki wo utsu wa shien naredo

mukuiru wa yo no kotowari

(bishamon:)

towa ni utsukushiku sakihokore

yuiitsu muni no utsuwa yo

honoo arite, sono hanaakari

eiga futatabi…

(both:)

kogase, kogase, to te hanakagari

hageshii honoo no mai

hito to tomo ni ite koso no kami

imawashiki akuji yurusaji

ENGLISH:

(bishamon:)

flying like the wind, kicking up soil

with an unbroken view of the world below

robust forefeet itching to move at twilight *

(kazuma:)

reading the direction, reading the distance

for a sacred/precious master

my mission is to give accurate instructions and directions

(bishamon (kazuma):)

with those never-mistaken eyes

(we must not miss)

searching for a target

(even a single flower petal)

(both:)

light up, light up, a bonfire of flowers

the dance of the grieving flames

it all fell apart in the middle of the full moon

those precious lives won’t come back

(bishamon:)

beyond the sky, beyond the darkness

our path lies open

(kazuma:)

our master’s enemy is our enemy

always one and the same

(kazuma (bishamon):)

with those unhesitating hands

(we must not miss)

hunting down evil

(even a single flower petal)

(both:)

burn, burn, a bonfire of flowers

the dance of the fierce flames

though I take my revenge to settle a personal grudge,

recompense is the way of the world

(bishamon:)

an eternally beautiful blossom

my one and only vessel

in the flames, the brilliance of those cherry blossoms

will be glorious once again…

(both:)

scorch, char, a bonfire of flowers

the dance of the fierce flames

gods exist to stay beside people

abominable evil cannot be forgiven

* as noted in canon, this word for twilight is literally “the time that demons meet,” similar to the english “witching hour”

愛は八百万 (Ai wa Yaoyorozu) - Kofuku & Daikoku (Toyosaki Aki & Ono Daisuke)

[KANJI]

ROMAJI:

Kofuku: atashi wa kofuku, ichiou kami desu~

Daikoku: ore wa daikoku, kofuku no shinki

Kofuku: futari awasetara “daifuku” da ne <3 *

(Daikoku: ___ no you ni genjitsu wa amakunai ga na…)

Kofuku: binbougami toka iwaretatte, atashi zenzen ki ni shinai yo

(Daikoku: sukoshi wa ki ni shiro…)

Kofuku: omizu dashippanishi de dete kichatta kedo <3

(Daikoku: yametekure, uchi no ___ dai ga!)

Daikoku: hontou doushiyou mo nai yatsu da ga, yaru toki wa yaru kamisan da ze

(Kofuku: hontou wa majimekun nan da yo!)

Both: tsuyoi kizuna no sono uchi ni, kazoekirenai ai ga aru!

Kofuku: atashi no koto zutto mitete <3

Both: ya o yo ro zu no tokimeki, ya o yo ro zu no kagayaki, futari nara okoseru ne, yaoyorozu no kiseki <3

Kofuku: chiisai atashi mamottekureru

(Daikoku: atarimae da yo!)

Kofuku: se no takai kare tanomoshii desu <3

(Daikoku: na, oi oi, tereru ze…)

Daikoku: tama ni wa ii koto iu janee ka! (ore naosee, kamisan… aishiteru ze)

Kofuku: mikake ni yorazu kare wa motto, chicchai kodomo ga daisuki nano!

(Daikoku: ___ chikan chigai sareru darou ga!)

Both: tsuyoi kizuna no sono uchi ni, kazoekirenai ai ga aru!

Daikoku: te wo dashitara yousha shinee!

Both: ya o yo ro zu no tokimeki, ya o yo ro zu no kagayaki, futari nara okoseru ne, yaoyorozu no kiseki <3

Kofuku: anata ga ireba atashi muteki, sukaato fuwari fuuketsu hirake!

(Kofuku: oide, kokki!)

(Daikoku: iku ze, kofuku!)

Both: komatta koto ga atta nara

Kofuku: atashi ga tasukete ageru yoo! osaisen wa ato de ii kara ne!

Both: ya o yo ro zu no tokimeki, ya o yo ro zu no kagayaki, futari nara okoseru ne, yaoyorozu no kiseki <3

Both: ya o yo ro zu no tokimeki, ya o yo ro zu no kagayaki, anata ni mo todokemasu, yaoyorozu no kiseki <3

ENGLISH:

Kofuku: I’m Kofuku, and I’m kind of a god~

Daikoku: I’m Daikoku, Kofuku’s shinki.

Kofuku: If you combine us, we’re “Daifuku” <3 * **

(Daikoku: ___ …the reality’s not that sweet)

Kofuku: people call me a god of poverty, but I don’t pay any attention to that!

(Daikoku: you should pay a little attention to that…)

Kofuku: though sometimes I do accidentally leave the water running <3

(Daikoku: stop that! ___)

Daikoku: there ain’t a lot she can do about that, but the missus sure gets things done when she tries.

(Kofuku: he’s so serious!)

Both: there’s endless love in such a strong bond!

Kofuku: watching over me all the time <3

Both: countless*** palpitations, countless glimmers, as long as we’re together we’ll make it happen, countless miracles <3

Kofuku: he protects little ol’ me!

(Daikoku: of course!)

Kofuku: he’s so tall and reliable <3

(Daikoku: aw, come on, you’re embarrassing me…)

Daikoku: doesn’t she say the nicest things, once in a while? (I’ll fix it, missus… ‘cause I love you.)

Kofuku: despite how he looks, he really likes small children!

(Daikoku: ___ …not in the perverted way!)

Both: there’s endless love in such a strong bond!

Daikoku: no mercy to anyone who lays a hand on her!

Both: countless palpitations, countless glimmers, as long as we’re together we’ll make it happen, countless miracles <3

Kofuku: when you’re here, I’m invincible. my skirt ripples softly as I OPEN THE VENT!

(Kofuku: come, Kokki!)

(Daikoku: let’s go, Kofuku!)

Both: if you’re ever in trouble,

Kofuku: I’ll be there to help. we can discuss the payments later!

Both: countless palpitations, countless glimmers, as long as we’re together we’ll make it happen, countless miracles <3

Both: countless palpitations, countless glimmers, I want you to know too, countless miracles! <3

* yes the hearts are written into the japanese lyrics

** “daifuku” also means “great fortune” or “good luck”

*** “yaoyorozu” (八百万) literally means “eight million,” but can be used figuratively to express any large number. in particular, one refers to “all the gods” with the phrase “yaoyorozu no kami,” not necessarily meant to imply that there are actually eight million deities but simply that there are too many to count.
